com.mb3364.twitch.api.resources

Class ChannelsResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mb3364.twitch.api.resources.AbstractResource
      • com.mb3364.twitch.api.resources.ChannelsResource

  • public class ChannelsResource
extends AbstractResource
    The ChannelsResource provides the functionality to access the /channels endpoints of the Twitch API.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class com.mb3364.twitch.api.resources.AbstractResource

        AbstractResource.TwitchHttpResponseHandler

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.mb3364.twitch.api.resources.AbstractResource

      Construct the resource using the Twitch API base URL and specified API version.

        Construct the resource using the Twitch API base URL and specified API version.
        Parameters:
        baseUrl - the base URL of the Twitch API
        apiVersion - the requested version of the Twitch API

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public void get(ChannelResponseHandler handler)
        Returns a channel object of authenticated user. Channel object includes stream key.

        Authenticated, required scope: Scopes.CHANNEL_READ

        Parameters:
        handler - the response handler

      • get

        public void get(java.lang.String channelName,
                ChannelResponseHandler handler)
        Returns a Channel object.
        Parameters:
        channelName - the name of the Channel
        handler - the response handler

      • getEditors

        public void getEditors(java.lang.String channelName,
                       UsersResponseHandler handler)
        Returns a list of user objects who are editors of channelName.

        Authenticated, required scope: Scopes.CHANNEL_READ

        Parameters:
        channelName - the name of the Channel
        handler - the response handler

      • put

        public void put(java.lang.String channelName,
                com.mb3364.http.RequestParams params,
                ChannelResponseHandler handler)
        Update channel's status, game, or delay.

        Authenticated, required scope: Scopes.CHANNEL_EDITOR

        Parameters:
        channelName - the name of the Channel
        params - the optional request parameters:
        • status: Channel's title
        • game: Game category to be classified as.
        • delay: Channel delay in seconds. Requires the channel owner's OAuth token.
        handler - the response handler

      • resetStreamKey

        public void resetStreamKey(java.lang.String channelName,
                           ChannelResponseHandler handler)
        Reset channel's stream key.

        Authenticated, required scope: Scopes.CHANNEL_STREAM

        Parameters:
        channelName - the name of the Channel
        handler - the response handler

      • startCommercial

        public void startCommercial(java.lang.String channelName,
                            int length,
                            CommercialResponseHandler handler)
        Start a commercial on channel.

        Authenticated, required scope: Scopes.CHANNEL_COMMERCIAL

        Parameters:
        channelName - the name of the channel
        length - Length of commercial break in seconds. Default value is 30. Valid values are 30, 60, 90, 120, 150, and 180
        handler - the response handler

      • getTeams

        public void getTeams(java.lang.String channelName,
                     TeamsResponseHandler handler)
        Returns a list of team objects the channel belongs to.
        Parameters:
        channelName - the name of the Channel
        handler - the response handler

      • getFollows

        public void getFollows(java.lang.String channelName,
                       com.mb3364.http.RequestParams params,
                       ChannelFollowsResponseHandler handler)
        Returns a list of follow objects representing the followers of a channel.
        Parameters:
        channelName - the name of the Channel
        params - the optional request parameters:
        • limit: Maximum number of objects in array. Default is 25. Maximum is 100.
        • offset: Object offset for pagination. Default is 0.
        • direction: Creation date sorting direction. Default is desc. Valid values are asc and desc.
        handler - the response handler

      • getFollows

        public void getFollows(java.lang.String channelName,
                       ChannelFollowsResponseHandler handler)
        Returns a list of follow objects representing the followers of a channel.
        Parameters:
        channelName - the name of the Channel
        handler - the response handler

      • getVideos

        public void getVideos(java.lang.String channelName,
                      com.mb3364.http.RequestParams params,
                      VideosResponseHandler handler)
        Returns a list of videos ordered by time of creation, starting with the most recent from specified channel.
        Parameters:
        channelName - the name of the Channel
        params - the optional request parameters:
        • limit: Maximum number of objects in array. Default is 10. Maximum is 100.
        • offset: Object offset for pagination. Default is 0.
        • broadcasts: Returns only broadcasts when true. Otherwise only highlights are returned. Default is false
        • hls: Returns only HLS VoDs when true. Otherwise only non-HLS VoDs are returned. Default is false.
        handler - the response handler

      • getVideos

        public void getVideos(java.lang.String channelName,
                      VideosResponseHandler handler)
        Returns a list of videos ordered by time of creation, starting with the most recent from specified channel.
        Parameters:
        channelName - the name of the Channel
        handler - the response handler

      • getSubscriptions

        public void getSubscriptions(java.lang.String channelName,
                             com.mb3364.http.RequestParams params,
                             ChannelSubscriptionsResponseHandler handler)
        Returns a list of subscription objects sorted by subscription relationship creation date which contain users subscribed to the specified channel.

        Authenticated, required scope: Scopes.CHANNEL_SUBSCRIPTIONS

        Parameters:
        channelName - the name of the Channel
        params - the optional request parameters:
        • limit: Maximum number of objects in array. Default is 25. Maximum is 100.
        • offset: Object offset for pagination. Default is 0.
        • direction: Creation date sorting direction. Default is asc. Valid values are asc and desc.
        handler - the response handler

      • getSubscriptions

        public void getSubscriptions(java.lang.String channelName,
                             ChannelSubscriptionsResponseHandler handler)
        Returns a list of subscription objects sorted by subscription relationship creation date which contain users subscribed to the specified channel.

        Authenticated, required scope: Scopes.CHANNEL_SUBSCRIPTIONS

        Parameters:
        channelName - the name of the Channel
        handler - the response handler

      • getSubscription

        public void getSubscription(java.lang.String channelName,
                            java.lang.String user,
                            ChannelSubscriptionResponseHandler handler)
        Returns a subscription object which includes the user if that user is subscribed.

        Authenticated, required scope: Scopes.CHANNEL_CHECK_SUBSCRIPTION

        Parameters:
        channelName - the name of the channel
        user - the user to check
        handler - the response handler
